Tales from the Perilous Realm (1992 radio series)

The Year's Work in English Studies

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==February==
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s "Philology: General Works" is published in ''[[The Year's Work in English Studies]]''.
==March==
* '''[[12 March|12]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to Ronald Ashton|a letter to Ronald Ashton]].
==June==
* '''?''' - ''[[Adventures in Unnatural History and Medieval Metres, being the Freaks of Fisiologus|Adventures in Unnatural History and Medieval Metres]]'' is published in ''The Stapeldon Magazine''.
==September==
* '''[[25 September|25]]''' - Producer and interviewer [[Denys Gueroult]] is born.
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] paints a [[:File:J.R.R. Tolkien - Dragon.jpg|coiled dragon]] derived from the poem ''[[Beowulf (poem)|Beowulf]]''.
* '''?''' - ''[[The Marvellous Land of Snergs]]'' is published.

==October==
* '''[[22 October|22]]''' - [[James Grout]], who would voice [[Barliman Butterbur]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' radio series]] and [[Nokes]] in [[Tales from the Perilous Realm (1992 radio series)|the ''Smith of Wootton Major'' episode]], is born.

==December==
* '''[[21 December|21]]''' - [[Father Christmas]] writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.
==?==
* '''?''' - ''[[The Song of Ælfwine|The Nameless Land]]'', a poem by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], is published in ''[[Realities: An Anthology of Verse]]''
* '''?''' - [[Edith Tolkien]] gives her husband [[Desk certificate 27 July 1972|a desk]], on which he will write ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.
{{Years|1924|1925|1926|1927|1928|1929|1930|}}
